page.title: 04Population
page.content: The number of people living in the area has increased steadily since 1920 when the then Earl of Abingdon sold his estate and many farms, homes and land became privately owned. Cumnor, Farmoor and Dean Court have become dormitories for people working in Oxford and elsewhere. There is a high proportion of professional and administrative people connected with the University of Oxford, local government, AERE Harwell, the National Health Service and similar organisations. Many people working at British Leyland Cowley also live in the area. About 220 people, most of them local, are employed within the area at Timbmet which occupies the site of the old Chawley brickworks.
